Sentencas: Typical electrolyte paste including Yittria Stabilized Zirconia (YSZ) and anode paste containing YSZ, NiO, starch/activated carbon (pore former) were prepared.
Titulo: Optimization of the rheology and sintering behavior of electrolyte and anode pastes to be used in co-extrusion of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In order to perform co-extrusion process the pastes must have nearly same rheological properties.
Titulo: Optimization of the rheology and sintering behavior of electrolyte and anode pastes to be used in co-extrusion of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: So, the prepared pastes unified in order to have same rheological characteristics using the Benbow-Bridgwater model.
Titulo: Optimization of the rheology and sintering behavior of electrolyte and anode pastes to be used in co-extrusion of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The unification results showed a linear relationship between the required liquid content for paste preparation and weight percentage of NiO powder in unified pastes.
Titulo: Optimization of the rheology and sintering behavior of electrolyte and anode pastes to be used in co-extrusion of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Such a linear relationship can be used to predict the required liquid content of the intermediate anode pastes.
Titulo: Optimization of the rheology and sintering behavior of electrolyte and anode pastes to be used in co-extrusion of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The unified pastes were extruded as single layer tubes and sintered at various experimental conditions.
Titulo: Optimization of the rheology and sintering behavior of electrolyte and anode pastes to be used in co-extrusion of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Micro-structural features of the sintered tubes were investigated using Scanning Electron Microscope (SEM) and optimum sintering temperature and time were found as 1450 degrees C and 2 h, respectively for full electrolyte densification.
Titulo: Optimization of the rheology and sintering behavior of electrolyte and anode pastes to be used in co-extrusion of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Moreover, 30 wt% of carbon may be regarded as the optimum carbon content for creating enough porosity in the anode layers.
Titulo: Optimization of the rheology and sintering behavior of electrolyte and anode pastes to be used in co-extrusion of solid oxide fuel cells
